text: May God continue to bless America. #September11
label: R

text: We are a nation of heroes, and today we have the opportunity to stand amongst them, to thank them, and to honor those lost.
label: R

text: We send our thoughts and prayers to those who are currently serving in the darkest and most hostile places on the planet.
label: R

text: Let us today remember those who lost their lives on 9/11 and those who have since made the ultimate sacrifice for our nation.
label: R

text: It is only together that we can successfully confront and defeat vile ideologies that seek to do us harm and destroy our way of life.
label: R

text: Friends and allies around the world stand with us, and we must stand with them.
label: R

text: The evil of ISIL and al-Qaida, and related and similar groups around the world, suffers no restraints except those that we impose upon it.
label: R

text: I can tell you that we are up to the challenge – as long as we do not forget the past. #September11
label: R

text: Today is a day for remembrance, it must also be a day for refocusing: the threat to America and her allies is real and unrelenting.
label: R

text: For our intelligence professionals, every day must be treated like September 12, 2001, with a constant refrain: ‘Never again’
label: R

text: They, too, have been working around the clock since the early hours after #September11.
label: R

text: The intelligence professionals, military and civilian, who serve America do an incredible job.
label: R

text: There are others in our nation’s service who are far less visible, yet equally worthy of our praise and admiration.
label: R

text: These men and women, regardless of the color of the uniform they wear, are serving with honor to ensure we are secure at home.
label: R

text: There are countless others who have heeded the call to duty, serving at home and abroad to keep an aggressive, resourceful enemy at bay.
label: R

text: The 82nd Airborne, 2nd Marine Division, special operations forces, & 4th Fighter Wing, are often called upon to be the first to fight.
label: R

text: Many of those heroes hail from towns we are so familiar with: Fayetteville, Jacksonville, Cherry Point, Goldsboro
label: R

text: We cannot, and will not, forget. #September11
label: R

text: Thousands have returned from the battlefield with grievous injuries, and so many have made the ultimate sacrifice.
label: R

text: Our service members and their families continue to sacrifice on behalf of all of us. #September11
label: R

text: Come October, they will have been at war for 15 years, taking the fight to the enemy so the enemy doesn’t bring the fight to our homes.
label: R

text: Our military remains engaged with the enemy in Afghanistan, Iraq, Syria, and in other parts of the world.
label: R

text: In communities across our nation, first responders stand ready to put their lives on the line so that others might live.
label: R

text: Our first responders, continue today as they did then: rushing toward the fire and the chaos, while most rush away.
label: R

text: We must also remember the sacrifices made by so many others since #September11.
label: R

text: I ask all of you to keep those families in your thoughts and prayers today. #September11
label: R

text: Every #September11 reopens wounds anew for families of those lost and for the children of 9/11 who grew up without ever knowing a parent.
label: R

text: It has been 15 years since the horrific attacks of #September11. We remember the families across this great nation who still mourn.
